text.textblock: Part of A-192 described as follows: Beginning on the East line of said A-192 at a point which lies N. 04
’ W., 4000 feet, from the Southeast corner of said A-192; Thence, S. 86
’ W., 900 feet, along the West line of said A-192; Thence, Easterly, approximately 6000 feet, along the southerly gradient boundary of Village Creek; Thence, S. 04
’ E., 300 feet, along the East line of said A-192, to the Point of Beginning.
Part of A-193 described as follows: Beginning on the East line of said A-193 at a point which lies N. 04
’ W., 5050 feet from the Southeast corner of said A-193; Thence, N. 59
’ W., 1650 feet, along the West line of said A-193; Thence, Easterly, approximately 3500 feet, along the southerly gradient boundary of Village Creek; Thence, S. 04
’ E., 900 feet, to the Point of Beginning.
Part of A-838 described as follows: Beginning at Turkey Creek Unit angle point no. 92; Thence, along the Easterly line of said Turkey Creek Unit the following 3 courses: 1. S. 34
’ W., 1201.85 feet, to angle point no. 91; 2. S. 03
’ E., 2960.10 feet, to angle point no. 90; 3. N. 71
’ E., 1516.87 feet, to angle point no. 89; Thence, N. 05
’ W., 2551.72 feet, along the West line of said A-838; Thence, N. 36
’ W., 1150 feet, to the Point of Beginning.
Part of A-97 described as follows: Beginning at Turkey Creek Unit angle point no. 89, said point being the Southwest corner of said A-97; Thence, N. 05
’ W., 762.39 feet, along the South line of said A-97, to the Point of Beginning.
Also land in Hardin County as follows:

All land lying between the Northerly and Easterly gradient boundary and southerly and westerly gradient boundary of Village Creek extending from the westerly line of the Lower Neches River Corridor Unit of the preserve upstream to the Easterly line of the Turkey Creek Unit of the preserve.
